subject: Continuum Mechanics
title: Kontinuumsmechanik (TUM, Module PH1007)
description: Continuum kinematics and balance laws; hydrodynamics with viscosity, Bernoulli and lift; flow regimes across Reynolds numbers; waves; linear elasticity, deformation tensors, elastic waves, and thin-body limits. Workload 300 h (90 h contact), 10 ECTS, winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Gerland, Ulrich. Language: EN.

goals.title: Continuum Mechanics – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner understands continuum kinematics and balances, hydrodynamics with viscous effects and flow regimes, and elasticity including waves and thin-body reductions.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner understands continuum kinematics and balances, hydrodynamics with viscous effects and flow regimes, and elasticity including waves and thin-body reductions.

goals.title: Kinematics & Balance Laws
goals.description: Learner can describe velocity fields of continua, continuity equations, and balance laws for mass/momentum/energy for simple systems.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can describe velocity fields of continua, continuity equations, and balance laws for mass/momentum/energy for simple systems.

goals.title: Hydrodynamics & Viscosity
goals.description: Learner can apply hydrodynamic equations with viscosity/stress tensor, Bernoulli’s equation, lift on moving bodies, and discuss viscous effects.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can apply hydrodynamic equations with viscosity/stress tensor, Bernoulli’s equation, lift on moving bodies, and discuss viscous effects.

goals.title: Flow Regimes & Waves
goals.description: Learner can distinguish laminar vs turbulent flow, analyze high/low Reynolds regimes, and describe basic wave phenomena in fluids.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can distinguish laminar vs turbulent flow, analyze high/low Reynolds regimes, and describe basic wave phenomena in fluids.

goals.title: Linear Elasticity & Waves
goals.description: Learner can use deformation tensors, energy balance, and equations of linear elasticity to describe deformations and elastic waves.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can use deformation tensors, energy balance, and equations of linear elasticity to describe deformations and elastic waves.

goals.title: Thin Bodies & Dimensional Reduction
goals.description: Learner can explain phenomena arising from reducing extended media to one- or two-dimensional models (thin bodies, shells, membranes).
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain phenomena arising from reducing extended media to one- or two-dimensional models (thin bodies, shells, membranes).

descriptionEn: Continuum kinematics and balance laws; hydrodynamics with viscosity, Bernoulli and lift; flow regimes across Reynolds numbers; waves; linear elasticity, deformation tensors, elastic waves, and thin-body limits. Workload 300 h (90 h contact), 10 ECTS, winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Gerland, Ulrich. Language: EN.
